Blueprint for Tomorrow

A transformational plan to elevate Jacksonville Golf & Country Club

Press Release Blueprint for Tomorrow Brochure
Golf Course Master Plan Contact Us
    

Project Highlights

Clubhouse Expansion

A brand-new, two-story, 18,000 sq. ft. facility adjacent to the main clubhouse will feature modern indoor and outdoor dining, a resort-style pool complex, expanded wellness and fitness spaces, spa amenities, and enhanced event and social gathering areas.

 Golf Course Renovation

A full redesign of the golf course by architect Andy Staples, focused on improving strategy, playability, and enjoyment for golfers of all skill levels. The design will introduce classically inspired features and upgraded infrastructure.

 Community-Driven Vision

Blueprint for Tomorrow was shaped by members through surveys, focus groups, and group presentations. The final plan was overwhelmingly approved in a club-wide vote, reflecting a shared commitment to JGCC’s long-term success.

Featured Quotes

"This is a historic moment for Jacksonville Golf & Country Club. Our members have embraced a vision for the future—one that strengthens our club’s legacy while positioning us as one of the premier private clubs in Northeast Florida." Jay Southerland, JGCC Board of Governors President

"For 30 years we have raised a family and made a home at JGCC. We are so happy that our friends and neighbors have approved a vision to elevate our club making it possible for many more families to proudly call it home for decades to come." Bobby Roche, JGCC Member

"JGCC has some great bones, but the infrastructure is well past its useful life. This plan not only addresses those critical needs—it gives us a chance to create something timeless. We’re blending classically inspired design elements with our own unique spin, and I couldn’t be more honored to help bring this vision to life alongside such a passionate membership." Andy Staples, Course Architect; ASGCA

"This project will give us a course that’s more fun, more playable, and more exciting every time you tee it up. We’re thrilled to have Andy leading the way as we write the next chapter of golf at JGCC." Patrick Cruz, JGCC Board of Governors and Golf Course Project Chair

“This is an incredible leap forward for JGCC. The planned infrastructure upgrades will position us strongly for the future. Andy’s design brings exciting advancements in both playability and agronomic performance. Our team is energized and eager to see this vision come to life. Thank you for the opportunity and trust to help lead JGCC into the next phase of its legacy.” Nate Maurer, JGCC Director of Agronomy

"Our family has been living here for the past 32 years, and we've always been proud to call Jacksonville Golf & Country Club home. Now, with the passage of 'Blueprint for Tomorrow', we can't wait to show our future grandchildren all the amazing upgrades and enjoy this club in ways we never imagined! Thank you, JGCC, for making this incredible investment in the future of our club!" Shannon Stanley, JGCC Member

Press

Club + Resort Business Jacksonville Business Journal
Florida Times Union Jacksonville Daily Record
    

Proposed project timeline 

Design, Documentation & Permitting

Dining, Pool & Fitness Building
Q3 2025 – Q3 2026
Clubhouse (Main Level)
Q3 2025 – Q3 2026
Golf Course
Q2 2025 – Q2 2027

Construction Phase

Dining, Pool & Fitness Building
Q3 2026 – Q3 2027
Golf Course Renovation
Q3 2027 – Q3 2028
Lower Level Clubhouse Renovation
Q3 2027 – Q2 2028 
During renovations, every effort will be made to sequence construction in a manner that minimizes disruption to the membership. Pool area enhancements are intended to occur following the 2026 pool season with every effort made to complete enhancements prior to the 2027 pool season.
